p: Another substance of quinone nature, tectoquinone (Î²-methyl anthraquinone), isolated from Cryptomeria japonica D. Don, showed a mosquito larvicidal activity against Aedes aegypti and A. albopictus [ 338]. It is believed that tectoquinone is responsible for the resistance of teak wood ( Tectona grandis L.f.) to insect attacks [ 339].
